page.title: 16EMPLOYMENT IN DUNDONALD
page.content: There is very little work for people actually in the village of Dundonald itself. The workers have to travel to work in some of the towns round about such as Irvine, Ayr, Prestwick, Kilmarnock or even the city of Glasgow. In the 1960's some factories were built close to the village providing local employment. These factories made {Nylon, Ball_bearings}and{Tractors.} Sadly all of these factories have now closed although a new {Chemical}works has been built fairly recently which provides some employment. In 1966 it was decided that the nearby town of{Irvine}should be developed as a "New Town" to attract industry and provide more jobs for local people. Unfortunately, this has not proved to be the success it was hoped and there is heavy unemployment.
